name: Improve Your Research Workflow Using Text Network Visualization
desc: You can visualize all the research notes and quotes you have in a graph, so you can see how it all connects, what are the main topics inside, how they relate to each other ....

name: How to use Zotero in your Research Workflow
desc: This video takes you through the three stage research workflow of Collecting, Organize and Citing your research using the free apps from Zotero.

name: Reproducible Data Analysis in Jupyter
desc: Jupyter notebooks provide a useful environment for interactive exploration of data. This series of videos presents a case study in how to approach reproducible data analysis within the Jupyter notebook.

name: Searching Google Scholar
desc: University students need to ensure that they are relying on credible, academic sources for their research. In recent years, Google has created its own academic database that may be more familiar to students used to using this search engine. When used correctly, Google Scholar can be a great research tool. To avoid information overload, however, watch this tutorial and follow the tips provided.

name: Creative User Research Methods for Startups
desc: The UX Research tool kit expands beyond traditional methods like usability tests and focus groups; come hear about creative UX research methods that can get insight in unexpected, quick ways to inform product decisions.

name: Research Culture is Broken; Open Science can Fix It
desc: After the increasingly toxic environment of modern research culture forced her to nearly abandon her career, astrophysicist Dr Rachael Ainsworth began to question why the subject she loved had become so inhospitable. Identifying some of the pressures placed on her peers that encouraged aggressive competitiveness, unfair benchmarking and shoddy research practices also helped her identify a compelling potential solution.

name: The Turing Way: A how to guide for reproducible research
desc: Kirstie Whitaker will present The Turing Way: a lightly opinionated guide to reproducible data science. Openly developed and community-led, this online book curates resources, case studies and checklists to make reproducible research 'Too easy not to do'.

name: Lean vs Agile vs Design Thinking
desc: As companies evolve to adopt, integrate, and leverage software as the defining element of their success in the 21st century, a rash of processes and methodologies are vying for their product teams' attention. In the worst of cases, each discipline on these teams -- product management, design, and software engineering -- learns a different model. This short, tactical talk reconciles the perceived differences in Lean Startup, Design Thinking, and Agile software development by focusing not on rituals and practices but on the values that underpin all three methods.

name: Beyond Design Thinking
desc: Design thinking seems to have taken the world by storm as hundreds of companies puzzle over how to integrate it into their organizations. Some claim outstanding results, others less so. In this session, we will dig under the hype, identify the core elements of what design thinking represents, and examine the path design thinking might take to be meaningful and useful in the future.

name: Getting started in R and RStudio
desc: Tutorial on the relationship between R and RStudio and how to install both pieces of software. Produced for use in my own teaching. Best viewed as part of the interactive tutorial at http://milton-the-cat.rocks/learnr/r/...

name: HR @Tableau | Improving our commute with employee survey data
desc: Transportation benefits are one way for companies to differentiate themselves in recruiting great talent. Using our own HR survey data, we were able to derive valuable insights into employee commute behavior and design a more effective transportation program.

name: How to Use Cornell Notes
desc: Learn how students use the Cornell Note Taking System.

name: Establish The Terms of Engagement During First Client Meeting
desc: What questions should I ask during the first client meeting? How you respond, during the first critical meeting with a design client, will determine if you will be in a position of power, or struggling to regain authority. Chris & Jose give you a step-by-step on how to handle your first meeting with a client.

name: Systematic Reviews: An Introduction
desc: This introduction to systematic reviews includes an explanation of what systematic reviews are, their history, the process involved in completing a systematic review, and an overview of how they differ from other common types of reviews. The video is not meant to be an in-depth examination of systematic reviews, but an overview to familiarize yourself with the publication type.

name: Get started with Google Colaboratory
desc: Want to get started with Google Colaboratory? In this episode of Coding TensorFlow, Software Engineer, Jake VanderPlas breaks down exactly what you need to get started with Colab. Colaboratory is a free Jupyter notebook environment that requires no setup, and runs entirely (writing, running, & sharing code) on the Cloud. Watch to learn more, and subscribe to get notified for the next Colab series episode, that focuses on the use of TensorFlow in Colab!

name: Improving Cornell Notes With Sketchnoting Techniques
desc: Make Cornell notes a bit more effective and a bit more visual by adding in some sketchnoting techniques.

name: Comparing EndNote, Mendeley, and Zotero
desc: Choosing citation management software and something to organize research materials requires a bit of thought. This video will provide brief overviews of the strengths and weaknesses of three popular options: EndNote, Mendeley, and Zotero.

name: Top 10 Logical Fallacies
desc: When creating a logical argument, there are many different aspects that have to come together to ensure that your argument is sound and does not contain any flaws. One of these aspects is avoiding what we call “logical fallacies.” A logical fallacy is an error of reasoning that will weaken your argument and, in most cases, undermine it completely.

name: Gitbook: Great Free-ish Tool to Build Your Docs Page
desc: Build a good-looking and searchable documentation for your projects, or private docs for your dev team.

name: Online Survey Methodology Guidelines
desc: Practical advise for conducting survey research online. Topics include: Solicitation strategies, design issues unique to psychology, and a comparison of platforms (e.g., SurveyMonkey vs. psychsurveys.org).

name: Jamovi for Data Analysis
desc: Open-source application that makes data analysis easy and intuitive.

name: How to Use JASP for Statistics
desc: Learn how to use Jasp for statistical analysis. This video will show you how JASP works, demonstrate its similarity with other statistics software, and get you familiar with how “progressive disclosure” allows you to focus on the analysis as you work

name: Event Storming
desc: Event Storming Event Storming is a highly visual, collaborative domain discovery and modelling method. It's a great way to get started sharing domain knowledge with different stakeholders.

name: The Rise Of Open-Source Software
desc: Open-source software powers nearly all the world’s major companies. This software is freely available, and is developed collaboratively, maintained by a broad network that includes everyone from unpaid volunteers to employees at competing tech companies. Here’s how giving away software for free has proven to be a viable business model.

name: Comparative Cognitive Mapping
desc: This video is part of our online course Multi-stakeholder Strategies: Analysis for Winning Coalitions.

name: How to ask a question: conducting research for your startup
desc: Join Google Search User Experience researcher Tomer Sharon as he shares interview techniques to help you get better answers in your customer research.

name: Learn to build your personal brand
desc: Donna Rachelson is founder of Branding & Marketing YOU a business focused on helping people develop and grow their personal brands

name: Build Your Brand on LinkedIn
desc: Learn why a strong personal brand is important for successful recruiting efforts, define the key components of a compelling personal profile, and learn ways to enhance your personal brand beyond your profile.

name: Correlation vs Causation: A Brief Guide To Communicating Research
desc: Using causal language when reporting research that only provides evidence of a correlation is one of the most common errors in science reporting.

name: Video is the Core Communication Tool of the Future
desc: Capturing and sharing video is now easier than ever. Yet consuming and creating with video remains hard. Our video interfaces today are still rooted in a timeline and force users to deal with individual frames despite advances in video understanding that now show who is in a video, what they are saying, and how they feel. In this talk Mira will present a framework for understanding common video tasks followed by research projects that point to possibilities for future video interaction.

name: How to use OBS for Screen Recording or Streaming
desc: In this step-by-step tutorial, learn how to get started using Open Broadcaster Software. OBS is an extremely powerful and versatile screen recorder and allows you to stream to services like Twitch, Facebook, and YouTube.

name: Project Retrospective
desc: Tom Wijmenga van Aresz Project Professionals legt in deze video uit hoe je een goede project retrospective met je team organiseert zodat ook jou project de volgende keer nóg beter gaat.

name: Quantum Computing Expert Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty
desc: WIRED has challenged IBM's Dr. Talia Gershon (Senior Manager, Quantum Research) to explain quantum computing to 5 different people; a child, teen, a college student, a grad student and a professional

name: Meet Coda
desc: Coda is a new doc that brings words, data, and teams together. It starts with a blinking cursor on a blank page and can grow as big as your team's ambition. Coda comes with a set of building blocksーlike pages for infinite depth, tables that talk to each other, and buttons that take action inside or outside your docーwhich anyone can combine to make a doc as powerful as an app. People have made Coda docs that do everything from launch products, to scale small businesses, to help them study for tests. What will you Coda?

name: The dschool Starter Kit
desc: The d.school Starter Kit is an online intro to design where you'll learn a medley of design abilities, methods, & mindsets.

name: Epics, User Stories & Tasks
desc: This video goes into more detail on the process of documenting requirements for the Product Backlog via the concept of Epics and User Stories and follows the Agile SCRUM methodology.

name: Making the web more visual with Web Stories
desc: Web Stories are a web-based version of the popular Stories format that blend video, audio, images, animation, and text to create a dynamic consumption experience. Learn about the why, what, and how of Web Stories and how Google has gone the extra mile to let Web Stories shine by providing the right tools and the right guidance for content creators to succeed on the web.

name: How Open Source Changed My Life with Max Stoiber
desc: Despite his young age of only 23, Max has achieved incredible things: he's created react-boilerplate and styled-components, his start-up, Spectrum, was recently acquired by GitHub and he gives talks all over the world. Learn more about his journey - and how he dropped out of university (twice!) - in this mini-doc.

name: Essential Tips for Collecting Great User Feedback
desc: Is user research worth it?🤔 Is it actually something you should do? How the #$%@ should you capture the data? If you want to improve your product, you MUST interview your users, or potential users. How should you document the feedback from the users? What tool should you use? No sweat. We’ve got you covered!🎯In our latest video, we dive into the ULTIMATE way to capture feedback from users!

name: Zero to UX: Escape the Research Death Spiral
desc: In order to create great products, proper UX research methods should be applied. Watch this video to learn how to avoid the most common UX research pitfalls.

name: Open Knowledge Maps
desc: In this webinar, founder Peter Kraker introduces Open Knowledge Maps, an interface that searches databases for research and presents search results visually, in the form of knowledge maps. The knowledge maps provide an instant overview of a topic by showing the main areas researched at a glance, and papers related to each area. Papers found are clustered together into similar topics.

name: Network Analysis with Gephi
desc: In this video, I show you how to install and use Gephi to do some basic network analysis of a large Ming dynasty social network derived from the China Biographical Database

name: What is A/B Testing?
desc: In this quick tutorial, we go over the basics of A/B testing, as well as answer some in-depth questions such as: why should businesses conduct A/B testing? Or how do you perform an A/B test?

name: Research impact: The impact cycle of research projects
desc: The research impact cycle: ever wondered how research impact evolves and how you can plan it? Then watch this vlog on the impact cycle tool. Have fun!

name: Watch me build a web app in 10 minutes without using code
desc: In this video I am building a searchable NoCode tools directory on bubble.io. I time myself to see if I can do it in under 10 minutes.

name: How I Organise My Life with Roam
desc: In this video, I'll be taking you through how I use Roam on a daily basis to take smart notes and organise all things important to me.

name: Roam Research - My Daily Review Workflow
desc: This is my current, and subject to change, daily review workflow using Roam Research.

name: Introduction to experiment design
desc: Introduction to experiment design. Explanatory and response variables. Control and treatment groups.

name: Jonge wetenschappers willen de wereld verbeteren
desc: Maud Hartstra en Juliette Boughouf van Thrive spreken jonge wetenschappers over kwantumfysica, circulair design en gedragseconomie!

name: RPA and Process Mining
desc: Process Mining lets you understand your process data and their dependencies to find patterns, anomalies and opportunities for improvement. Compare designed processes to as-is processes to see if they execute as planned and make changes before they impact your bottom line. Simulate and analyze process optimization scenarios to determine the best path to improvement. RPA, standing for robotic process automation, except with AI and machine learning included – has long been the future as a form of business process automation technology, harnessing software robots or AI (artificial intelligence) units or digital workers.

name: Analysing Textual Data
desc: * Content analysis: conceptual analysis and relational analysis * Coding scheme development: inductive, deductive, hybrid, coding scheme structure * Coding in Atlas.ti: open coding, applying codes, coding to facilitate relational analysis * Analysis and output in Atlas.ti: conceptual analysis, and relational analysis

name: Making Data-driven Decisions in Business
desc: Learn about how data can empower our decisions, big and small, the difference between quantitative and qualitative analysis and when to use them, the pros and cons of different data visualization tools, what metrics are and how analysts use them, and how to use mathematical thinking to connect the dots.

name: Agent-Based Modeling
desc: These videos are from the Introduction to Agent Based Modeling course on Complexity Explorer (complexityexplorer.org) taught by Prof. Bill Rand. This course will explore how to use agent-based modeling to understand and examine a widely diverse and disparate set of complex problems.

name: How to level up your business's digital transformation
desc: How we use process mining as the starting point to support your digital transformation.
